text: Facade / Building Envelope Engineer or Architect
address: New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking an engineer or architect with 2 to 5 years of restoration experience.

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs.

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.
Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).
SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.
Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday.

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away.

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday.

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away.

WHO WE ARE: MIDI is an established Award Winning Product Development firm located in Smithtown, NY specializing in innovative product engineering and design solutions for the medical and scientific markets. With over 45 years of product development consulting experience, having served clientele representing diverse industries both in the US and internationally, our success is based on our multi-disciplined, talented team. And, we are seeking additional team members!
WHO WE SEEK: Here is a basic description of how our instruments are typically structured and the type of skill-set we would be looking for in a Senior Electrical Engineer:

Starting from a high-level, the systems are typically controlled by Windows on an off-the-shelf SBC.  Within the Windows environment we need to develop a program and GUI to control the instrument using C#.NET.  The SBC will then instruct our "Main Embedded PCB" on tasks it needs to perform.  This Main-PCB will control/sense a combination of both analogue and digital components like PID-Heating, stepper motors, pumps, RTD, TC, optical & hall interrupts, etc.  We will need to generate schematics/layout/BOM on this PCB along with the C-code firmware to control the components.  Successful Engineers at MIDI are involved in the conceptualization and development of new and innovative products and work directly on-site as a team member and with our client's staff. Your role will be to design and prototype designs using EDA software and testing and improving upon designs.

WHO YOU ARE: You should possess a BS or MS and ideally 5+ years of Experience.   Additionally, you are enthusiastic, creative and a hands-on person.  As a strategic, critical and analytical thinker, you are creative at problem solving, intellectually curious, independent, self-starting and proactive. You are comfortable having daily contact with the company owners and can manage programs involving engineering/product development with ease.
If you are interested, please reply to this posting with only a PDF resume. No jpegs or photos please. We look forward to hearing from you!

text: Facade / Building Envelope Engineer or Architect
address: New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking an engineer or architect with 2 to 5 years of restoration experience.

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs.

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.
Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).
SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.
Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday.

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away.

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).

ERS seeks a candidate who is passionate about improving energy efficiency, maximizing economic competitiveness, and minimizing environmental impacts. The candidate will be responsible for the management and development of the ERS analytics practice. Candidates should have 5 or more years of experience, with an emphasis on project management and leadership and that includes knowledge of Python, statistical analysis, and database management. We are looking for an individual ready to make their mark in this field and to mold a young and enthusiastic team. An advanced degree in economics or quantitative social science is preferred.

ERS is a progressive energy engineering consulting firm specializing in the implementation and evaluation of energy efficiency projects and programs. ERS is one of the leading energy management and environmental consulting firms in the United States, providing technical, policy, implementation, and program advisory services to clients throughout the US and Canada and abroad.

The ERS staff has been involved in some of the largest and most ambitious programs, energy projects, and research studies addressing resource conservation in the country. Our areas of specialization include assessment and implementation of energy efficiency projects; utility program planning, management, and evaluation; renewable/sustainable development assessment; continuous metering and monitoring; development of analytical tools and database software systems for energy analysis; technology assessment; premium efficiency lighting design; and energy code compliance.
Related projects that this position will involve include:
-Statistical sampling and aggregate analysis techniques to assess statistical precision
-Predictive models for energy efficiency savings and program evaluation
-Analytical models that identify customers with high energy-saving potential
-Time-series data pipeline including cleaning, storage, aggregations, and anomaly detection
-Experience in energy, consulting, and project management and strong technical knowledge of energy efficiency practices and programs are also highly desirable.
-The ability to work closely with customers, vendors, and efficiency program administrators is essential, as are business development, administration, design, and/or project management skills.
To apply for this position send a cover letter with your resume to recruiting@ers-inc.com.
